properties.headline: Flood Warning issued January 25 at 11:56AM EST until January 25 at 6:15PM EST by NWS Charleston WV
properties.description:
The National Weather Service in Charleston West Virginia has extended
the

* Flood Warning for...
Northeastern Washington County in southeastern Ohio...

* Until 615 PM EST Saturday.

* At 1150 AM EST, the gauge on Duck Creek at Macksburg was in crest
at 13.93 feet which is almost a foot above bankfull. At stages
between 13 and 15 feet Broad Street starts to flood near the
creek. Homes on the left bank start to flood. Campground next to
gage floods. Downstream, the gauge at Whipple was nearing crest at
bankfull level of 12 feet. Between 11 and 13 feet, sections of
State Routes 26, 821, and 145 are flooded. Water levels will begin
to slowly recede through the afternoon.

* The gauge on the Little Muskingum River at Bloomfield indicated
the river had crested and was slowly receding. The current level
was 18.27 feet. Route 26 near the intersection with Route 260 are
flooded between 16 and 20 feet.

* Some locations that will experience flooding include...
Macksburg, Lower Salem,  and Devola.
properties.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood
deaths occur in vehicles.

In hilly terrain there are hundreds of low water crossings which are
potentially dangerous in heavy rain. Do not attempt to cross flooded
roads. Find an alternate route.

Please report flooding to the National Weather Service by calling
toll free, 800 401 9535, when you can do so safely.

You may also report flooding by posting your report to the Charleston
West Virginia National Weather Service Facebook Page, or by using the
Twitter Hashtag, NWSRLX.
